title: Contemporary Typographers
content: I need to research several well known contemporary typographers. And by typographers, I mean artists who use typography, not necessarily those who create it. If anyone could help it would really be appreciated. Thanks!
author: Brittany_Lynn

comments.content:
"Narrow" your definition of "artist," say the medium (or which message).  
 The “ [Bit.Fall](http://web.archive.org/web/20100315120406/http:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=AICq53U3dl8&eurl=)” by Julius Popp is certainly one of the best works I have seen lately, indeed a excellent mesh of creativity and engineering.

Just a few well known book designers who cross my mind:  
 [Irma Boom](http://web.archive.org/web/20100315120406/http:/www.irmaboom.nl/)  
 [Markus Dreßen](http://web.archive.org/web/20100315120406/http:/www.microtyp.org/)  
 [Friedrich Forssman](http://web.archive.org/web/20100315120406/http:/www.lesetypografie.de/)  
 [Franz Greno](http://web.archive.org/web/20100315120406/http:/www.fontshop.de/typo96/speakers/greno.html) …
Take a look at the top 10 people they have listed on lettercult.com - should find what you're looking for there, or atleast it could be a start to finding others you may like to research
